title: 5E Model-Based STEM Pandemic Inquiry Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistics, foundational biology concepts, and understanding of mathematical modeling
context.additional_context: Project-based learning that promotes interdisciplinary thinking in blended (face-to-face/online) environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the correlation between exponential function models and actual infection rates using pandemic data with 80% accuracy.
Learners can propose interdisciplinary problem-solving solutions using collaboration tools (Padlet, Jamboard, etc.) in STEAM fields.
Learners can design experiments according to the 5E model phases (Engage-Explore-Explain-Elaborate-Evaluate) and conduct peer reviews.
Learners can implement an infectious disease spread simulation based on bacterial culture experiment results and predict outcomes within a 15% error margin.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
